  • City: GOODYEAR
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RECEIVED A CALL FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE FROM THE LOAD WALL. UPON ARRIVAL, RESPONDER IDENTIFIED THE SAID PACKAGE. PLACED PACKAGE IN SPILL TRAY. CLEANED UP CONTAMINATED DEBRIS. TRANSPORTED TO DMNP AREA FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report I-2024090053
item.description:
Report I-2024090053

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-24
  • City: Tucson
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: About 30 minutes after take off from ORD passenger Richard Grelson advised the flight crew he dropped his phone because it was getting hot in his pocket. The flight attendant then got the fire containment bag and retrieved the phone and placed it in the fire thermal runaway bag for the remainder of the flight. The CA called into TUS to advise about the overheated phone. Upon meeting the aircraft, CSM retrieved the bag from the flight attendant. The phone was no longer over heated and was then returned to the customer after deplaning the aircraft. Passenger Richard was sitting in 14e. We were in the middle of the service when he told me that his phone was hot. I asked if it was just charging and he said no it was in his pocket and the phone wasn't working. I immediately grabbed the phone and grabbed the fire containment bag. After putting the phone in the bag I took it and put it in the cart in the aft galley. I then asked passenger Richard what happened before the flight and he said he dropped the phone before boarding the flight and the phone turned off and didn't work after that. He thought it was ok. Then his phone started to get hot in his pocket. I told the captain everything. Then the csm took it once we were fully deplaned in Tucson.
